title: Rare drop table

properties.name: description
properties.value: The rare drop table or RDT is a drop table that is accessed by medium-level and high-level monsters. The rare drop table drops some rune items and other items of moderate value, and also has access to the gem drop table as a subtable. The rare drop table also has a chance at rolling the Mega-rare drop table.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Rare drop tableThe RuneScape Classic Wiki also has an article on: classicrsw:Rare drop table

The rare drop table or RDT is a drop table that is accessed by medium-level and high-level monsters. The rare drop table drops some rune items and other items of moderate value, and also has access to the gem drop table as a subtable. The rare drop table also has a chance at rolling the Mega-rare drop table.

The Mega-rare drop table contains mostly empty drops, but also the rune spear, dragon spear and shield left half. The player does NOT need to have Legends' Quest completed to access the Mega-rare drop table via the rare drop table.

Some monsters will have their rare drop table drops appear on an adjacent tile to the rest of the loot pile when the rare drop table is rolled. This can help the player distinguish if the drop came from the rare drop table or their standard drop table, if both tables share some of the same drops.

Contents

  • 1 Talisman
  • 2 Rare drop table
    • 2.1 Runes and ammunition
    • 2.2 Weapons and armour
    • 2.3 Other
    • 2.4 Sub-tables
  • 3 Gem drop table
  • 4 Mega-rare drop table

Talisman[edit | edit source]

Depending on the monster's map coordinates, the monster will drop either a Chaos talisman or Nature talisman. Overworld monsters drop the Nature talisman whereas underground monsters drop the Chaos talisman. Some monsters can drop either talisman if they exist at multiple locations, such as fire giants.

Rare drop table[edit | edit source]

At current prices, the expected value of a drop is approximately 7,965.4.
